availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac N. Webb (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and hotelkeeper)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and hotelkeeper. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Baskett Webb in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on October 31, 1838. Father of Tabitha J. Webb, John H. Webb, Mildred Webb, Elizabeth M. Webb, Louisa T. Webb, Harriet F. Webb, Alpha Webb, and Susannah Webb. Farmer in Nicholas County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Nicholas County in 1850. Hotelkeeper in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District No. 2, p. 408B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District No. 2, p. 297.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 568.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film #000252392, p. 56.
